Operation 'get-loan-summary' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects, poor_ai_interpretability. The current description lacks clarity on what constitutes a 'loan summary' and what specific fields are returned. It doesn't explain the practical use case or why organizing by integration type matters. The summary is generic. Improved version clarifies the aggregation logic, emphasizes the multi-source nature of the data, explains the prerequisite (recent sync), and adds context about the operation's purpose for financial assessment. This helps AI agents understand when to use this endpoint (liability assessment) and what to expect from the response.

data.current_description:
The *Get loan summaries* endpoint returns a summary by integration type of all loans identified from a company's accounting, banking, and commerce integrations.

The endpoint returns a list of a company's [loan summaries](https://docs.codat.io/codat-api#/schemas/LoanSummary) for each valid data connection.

Make sure you have [synced a company](https://docs.codat.io/codat-api#/operations/refresh-company-data) recently before calling the endpoint.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve loan summaries by integration type
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a comprehensive summary of all loans identified across a company's accounting, banking, and commerce data connections, organized by integration type. Returns a list of loan summaries for each valid data connection. Requires the company to have been recently synced to ensure data accuracy. Useful for assessing liability exposure and loan portfolio composition across multiple data sources.
data.reasoning: The current description lacks clarity on what constitutes a 'loan summary' and what specific fields are returned. It doesn't explain the practical use case or why organizing by integration type matters. The summary is generic. Improved version clarifies the aggregation logic, emphasizes the multi-source nature of the data, explains the prerequisite (recent sync), and adds context about the operation's purpose for financial assessment. This helps AI agents understand when to use this endpoint (liability assessment) and what to expect from the response.

message: Operation 'get-commerce-orders-metrics' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_output_details. Original summary 'Get orders report' is vague and doesn't specify this is a metrics/analytics endpoint. Description lacks specificity about what order information is returned. Enhanced version clarifies this returns metrics/analytics (not raw orders), specifies typical return data (volume, value, trends), and aligns terminology with the Reports tag context.

data.current_description: Gets the order information for a specific company connection, over one or more periods of time.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves order metrics and analytics for a specific company connection across one or more time periods. Returns order volume, value, and trend data to support commerce performance analysis.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Get orders report' is vague and doesn't specify this is a metrics/analytics endpoint. Description lacks specificity about what order information is returned. Enhanced version clarifies this returns metrics/analytics (not raw orders), specifies typical return data (volume, value, trends), and aligns terminology with the Reports tag context.

message: Operation 'get-commerce-refunds-metrics' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_output_details. Original summary 'Get refunds report' is generic and doesn't clarify this is a metrics endpoint. Description is vague about what refund information is provided. Enhanced version specifies metrics/analytics focus, indicates typical return data (volume, value, trends), and provides business context for AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: Gets the refunds information for a specific company connection, over one or more periods of time.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves refund metrics and analytics for a specific company connection across one or more time periods. Returns refund volume, value, and trend data to assess commerce performance and customer satisfaction.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Get refunds report' is generic and doesn't clarify this is a metrics endpoint. Description is vague about what refund information is provided. Enhanced version specifies metrics/analytics focus, indicates typical return data (volume, value, trends), and provides business context for AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'get-commerce-lifetime-value-metrics' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Summary uses singular 'metric' which is inconsistent with other operations and potentially misleading about return data structure. Enhanced version uses plural 'metrics' for consistency and clarity. Description is adequate but could benefit from specifying what lifetime value data is returned (e.g., average CLV, cohort analysis).

data.current_description: Gets the lifetime value metric for a specific company connection, over one or more periods of time.
data.reasoning: Summary uses singular 'metric' which is inconsistent with other operations and potentially misleading about return data structure. Enhanced version uses plural 'metrics' for consistency and clarity. Description is adequate but could benefit from specifying what lifetime value data is returned (e.g., average CLV, cohort analysis).

message: Operation 'request-recurring-revenue-metrics' has semantic quality issues: unclear_purpose, not_actionable, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original description is vague about whether this is synchronous or asynchronous, what metrics are generated, and what is returned. The GET method combined with 'Requests production' suggests async processing but this is unclear. Enhanced version clarifies this is an async request, specifies typical metrics (MRR, ARR, churn), explains the return value (status), and directs to the companion endpoint for retrieving results. Critical for AI agent to understand the workflow.

data.current_description: Requests production of key subscription revenue metrics.
data.description_suggestion: Initiates asynchronous generation of key subscription revenue metrics (MRR, ARR, churn rate) for a specific company connection. Returns a status response indicating the request has been queued for processing. Use get-recurring-revenue-metrics to retrieve results once processing completes.
data.reasoning: Original description is vague about whether this is synchronous or asynchronous, what metrics are generated, and what is returned. The GET method combined with 'Requests production' suggests async processing but this is unclear. Enhanced version clarifies this is an async request, specifies typical metrics (MRR, ARR, churn), explains the return value (status), and directs to the companion endpoint for retrieving results. Critical for AI agent to understand the workflow.

message: Operation 'get-recurring-revenue-metrics' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details. Summary is adequate and action-oriented. Description is too vague about which specific metrics are returned. Enhanced version specifies the key metrics (MRR, ARR, churn rate), clarifies the scope (aggregated metrics and trends), and provides business context. This helps AI agents understand what data to expect and when to use this endpoint versus other commerce metrics endpoints.

data.current_description: Gets key metrics for subscription revenue.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves key subscription revenue metrics including Monthly Recurring Revenue (MRR), Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR), and churn rate for a specific company connection. Returns aggregated metrics and trend analysis to assess subscription business performance.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate and action-oriented. Description is too vague about which specific metrics are returned. Enhanced version specifies the key metrics (MRR, ARR, churn rate), clarifies the scope (aggregated metrics and trends), and provides business context. This helps AI agents understand what data to expect and when to use this endpoint versus other commerce metrics endpoints.

data.current_description:
> **Categorization engine**
> 
> The categorization engine uses machine learning and has been fully trained against Plaid and TrueLayer banking data sources. It is not fully trained against the Basiq banking data source.
 
The Enhanced Cash Flow Transactions endpoint provides a fully categorized list of banking transactions for a company. Accounts and transaction data are obtained from the company's banking data sources.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a fully categorized list of banking transactions for a company's cash flow analysis. Transactions are automatically categorized using a machine learning engine trained on Plaid and TrueLayer banking data (note: Basiq data source categorization is not fully trained). Returns individual transactions with their assigned categories, enabling detailed cash flow reporting and analysis.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Get enhanced cash flow report' is vague - this endpoint returns transactions, not a report. Description buries the key information (categorized transactions) after technical details about the ML engine.
